name: lexsenthur
text: and now it is at 69 chubbies. Unless we can rally and bring it to 1024, it should stay as it is.

name: tibcoolbreeze
text:
Two days later, it remains at 69 chubbies. How long can it last?

Meanwhile, how do we support the comment? Lame it?

name: fineoakstructure
text: How long can it last? Not 3 days, apparently.  71 chubbies, 1 lame as of 6/11/08.

name: dusty
text: As of now the situation seems to be improving. No word yet on a definite ID of the lamer, but witnesses suggest that it was a sad angry jealous man with a small penis and a hatred for anyone funnier than him, Jerry Seinfeld has been taken in for questioning. The comment continues to be awesome, and the situation remains tense that it may be mislamed again. Back to you Fineoak Structure.

text: I'd say it's the thought that matters, but Ray Smuckles ain't the kind of guy to mix with thought. He and thought aren't speaking the same language. They ain't even in the same hemisphere. They may not even see the same sun.

text: Reminds me of the special Burger King Kids Club birthday comic book you could get with YOUR NAME printed in it with a dot-matrix printer. Broke my damn little heart.

text: Someone please go make this mad lib romance novel company. Please. The world *needs it*.

text:
i seriously am in love with this idea. it makes me want to buy some hormel tamales just to see what they're like.

if you do this as an achewood thing for this coming christmas, chris, I WILL PAY

text:
Wait, so this doesn't exist?

Fuck, there goes pretty much my entire Christmas game plan.

text: Such things exist , alright. Now you need only choose a theme. Strangers in Paris? Taming the Tycoon? Vampire Kisses? Oh, the possibilities...

Hmmmm... I'd say S.S. is about 2/5 R.B. and 1/5 C.B.
The final two fifths is some kind of pathetic passivity that neither of these characters exhibit.

text: I have had many friends where the best description for their girlfriend was "nice, not my type."  Classic.

name: zeroasalimit
text: A comment left by zeroasalimit was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by aquamuffin, ghoti, STUART)

name: epicurus
text: I had to explain to a lot of my friends why the grammar was strange in the text. Those people are no longer my friends (because they are dumb as hell).

name: falseprophet
text: Somehow, the combination of stilted romanticism with Ray's "hey man" attitude has achieved a prose style with Pynchonian overtures. Bravo Ray. Bravo.

name: wehavemagnums
text: This is one of the few strips that had me sitting in front of my computer laughing out loud for an extended amount of time.

name: zerobot
text: It's fun to imagine what fields he was filling out on the form. "Sexy breakfast food: those canned Hormel tamales with the little piece of paper in between each one. " I like the way Ray thinks.

name: cailetshadow
text:
Heh! Yeah, Beef! I did commission Molly a special tombstone along with the romance novel! They were havin' a deal, so I figured, you know, why not?

~ Molly Sanders ~
Nice, Not My Type
1666-1676, 2004 - I don't know, probably a lot longer than Beef, heh.

name: snowman
text: MAN this strip rules with an iron fist

name: flash1087
text: I guess I just glazed over this one at first, I don't remember it being so funny. I got to "some crappy-assed waitress job" and honestly laughed out loud.

name: dwodles
text: This is beyond brilliant. Can anyone read the alt text? All Firefox is letting me see is "Molly seductively slid a raunchy little tamale across her I haven't really noticed them..."

name: corpsey
text:
The whole thing is "Molly seductively slid a raunchy little tamale across her I haven't really noticed them lips, and soon..."

Which is also great. Right click and select "Properties" to see the whole thing in firefox.

name: kayakcabble
text:
His nothin' to write home about chest.
that cracks me up every time

name: doc_rostov
text:
I love the implication that there are chests that are worth writing home about.

"Dearest Mother,

Today, I spent a long hour staring into the rippled depths of my abdomen. Little profits an idle and shirtless man of my caliber, lest they find themselves too firmly engrossed in their wonder as to perform the tasks they must do. My abs were like a chum of old times, inviting me to visit a world where no activity exists besides staring at their glory. This is my life.

Your loving son,
Vladimir"

name: fermatprime
text: this has, like, 1/10 of the chubbies it deserves.

text:

text: "oh, uh, i guess it reads okay, Ray, i mean it's pretty okay .  there's maybe a thing or two i would have done differently, you know, if i had done it at all.  which i wouldn't have."
